Discusion routine - whole group
subtitle: Rumors
desc: To look for patterns in ideas, learners circulate around the room carrying their response written on a paper. They listen to a partner's idea, share their own idea, and swap papers. Then they find a new partner to: listen, share, & swap - looking for patterns in responses.

title: Individual thinking routine
subtitle: I used to think.. Now I think... So next I will
desc: This thinking routine is used for students to monitor how and why their thinking has changed. This sentence starter prompts push students to consider their next learning steps, completing a cycle of self-regulation.

title: Discusion routine - whole group
subtitle: Idea Carousel
desc: Post topics and chart paper around the room (one topic per chart paper). Ask participants to go to a topic that interests them most. Ask students to write down knowledge, questions, or concerns about the topic on the chart paper. Ask students to rotate to the next chart and repeat this process.

title: Discusion routine - pairs
subtitle: Dialogue Lines
desc: Dialogue Lines or Dialogue Circles is a learning routine in which students move from one partner discussion to another, rehearsing a common way of talking about a particular topic.

title: Discusion routine - pairs
subtitle: Questions Only
desc: Students work in pairs to generate questions around a prompt, image, or data set.

title: Discusion routine - pairs
subtitle: Turn - Exchange - Sort
desc: Students are assigned the role or listener and speaker, taking turns to exchange their thinking (answer, question, opinion, observation). Then the pair sorts the thinking (prioritize, compare, sequence, or summarize).

title: Discusion routine - small groups
subtitle: Think - Talk - Open Exchange
desc: This is a routine for students in small groups to share ideas, listen to one another, and build upon each others’ ideas.

title: Discusion routine - small groups
subtitle: Read - Generate - Sort - Solve
desc: This is a routine that promotes student engagement in problem-solving by helping students make their thinking transparent along the way.

title: Discusion routine - whole group
subtitle: Domino Share
desc: This routine helps groups share efficiently, giving each person an opportunity to participate.

title: Explicit instruction
subtitle: Mini-Lesson
desc: Teacher provides a short mini-lesson.

title: Individual task
subtitle: Star Most Interesting & Box Most Challenging
desc: Students place a star next to the most interesting word/problem/question and draw a box around the most challenging aspect.

title: Discussion routine
subtitle: Idea Carousel
desc: Post chart papers with different topics around the room. Ask participants to go to a topic that interests them most. Ask students to write on chart paper knowledge, questions, or concerns about the topic. Ask students to rotate to the next chart and repeat this process.

title: Free discussion
subtitle: Turn and Talk
desc: A completely unstructured time to talk and listen to others in a small group.

title: Free discussion
subtitle: Talk to Peers
desc: A completely unstructured time to talk and listen to others in a small group.

title: Discussion routine
subtitle: Elbow Exchange and Sort
desc: Students are assigned the role of listener or speaker, taking turns to exchange their thinking (answer, question, opinion, observation). Then the pair sorts the thinking (prioritize, compare, sequence, or summarize).

title: Explicit instruction
subtitle: Short Movie Clip
desc: Students watch a short movie clip to find information to answer a question.

title: Individual task
subtitle: Check and Circle
desc: Students independently read or scan a text placing a check next to three words that are familar and circling one thing that seems new.

title: Discussion routine
subtitle: Domino Share
desc: A representative from each group shares a response. Listeners listen for missing ideas/patterns and contribute additional ideas after the representatives share. Teachers record and evaluate the responses.

title: Explicit instruction
subtitle: Mini-lesson
desc: Teacher demonstrates a concept, defines vocabulary, or provides an example.

title: Individual task
subtitle: I used to think... Now I think... So next I will..
desc: Independently, students monitor how and why their thinking has changed by completing the sentence prompt,  "I used to think..."

title: Discussion routine
subtitle: Rumors
desc: To look for patterns in ideas, learners circulate around the room carrying their response written on a paper. They listen to a partner's idea, share their own idea, and swap papers. Then they find a new partner to: listen, share, & swap - looking for patterns in responses.

title: Free discussion
subtitle: Turn and Talk
desc: A completely unstructured time to talk and listen to others in a small group.

title: Individual task
subtitle: Questions Only
desc: Students generate questions around a prompt, image, or data set.

title: Individual task
subtitle: Silent Think Time
desc: Students silently think in their head. No writing or speaking.

title: Explicit instruction
subtitle: Short Movie Clip
desc: Students watch a short movie clip to find information to answer a question.

title: Discussion routine
subtitle: Dialogue Lines
desc: Students form two lines, one line speaks first, then the other, finally they have a short conversation and then one line moves one step to meet a new partner. The process is repeated until students have conversed with two or three different partners.

title: Discussion routine
subtitle: Domino Share
desc: Each student in a group shares a response. Listeners listen for missing ideas/patterns and contribute ideas after the share. Students use criteria to prepare a reporter to share a high quality response.

subtitle: Materials and Tools
desc: (i.e. calculator, ruler)

subtitle: Materials and Tools

title: Total student choice
subtitle: Offer different options

title: Teacher-structured student choice
subtitle: Teacher requires 3 and students choose 2 additional questions

title: Total student choice
subtitle: Students respond by drawing, writing, or making a list.

subtitle: Tic Tac Toe
